Name: Zázraky přírody
Description:
Do you feel that the offspring have asked you for a thousand answers? Give it back to them with the fun family game Miracles of Nature inspired by the TV show of the same name. A dynamic game with a thousand questions combines education with playfulness and will entertain anyone who joins it. You will move around the game board for the correct answers and go to your destination. In addition, your opponents will choose the final question. In addition to learning a lot of new things, you will also try a number of home attempts!

—description from a publisher (translated)

Name: Transformers Trading Card Game: Bumblebee vs Megatron Starter Set
Description:
The Transformers Trading Card Game is a battling card game designed for two players. Players build a team of Transformers character cards and power them up with a customizable deck of battle cards. Transformers character cards are twice the size of standard playing cards; they can be flipped from bot mode to alt mode and back, and they feature premium printing treatment on one of their sides. The deck of battle cards features Action and Upgrade cards to enhance Transformers character cards.

This BUMBLEBEE VS MEGATRON Starter Set contains cards for 2 players to begin the action.

For full gameplay, 2 players can add cards from Transformers TCG Booster Packs, or 1 player can use these BUMBLEBEE VS MEGATRON Starter Set cards right out of the box.

Contents:
4 Foil Transformers Character Cards
Ready-to-Play Deck of 40 Battle Cards
Damage Counters
Rules Insert

Name: Urban Manhunt: The Miniatures Game
Description:
Urban Manhunt is a miniatures game based on a violent near-future blood sport. It is meant to be an inexpensive game that requires only one miniature per player and that can also be played solo. Best of all, the hunter creation system allows you to create stats for virtually any miniature you own.

Matches in Urban Manhunt take place in zones, sectioned-off areas of partially destroyed cities that are used as prisons. Highly-trained, larger-than-life mercenaries known as hunters are set loose in the zone to compete with each other by “eliminating” crims (“criminals”, prisoners who volunteer to take their chances in return for full pardons if they survive).

Each crime is assigned a base point value by the Urban Manhunt Rules Committee, based on their competency. When a hunter eliminates the crim, they receive that number of points. This amount can be modified by the live studio audience based on how flashy, interesting or gory the elimination is. The hunter with the most points when the time limit expires wins the match.

—description from the publisher

Name: Pot po Jugoslaviji. Put kroz Jugoslaviju
Description:
Pot po Jugoslaviji. Put kroz Jugoslaviju game titel translation from both Slovak and Croatian languages - "The way through Yugoslavia".

A mid 1930s Yugoslavian pan-Slavic board-game published in Ljubljana, Slovenia, circa 1935 by a famous illustrator and painter Mirko Šubic (1900-1976).

Mirko Šubic was born in a Slovenian family of artists and architects. He studied art in Munich under Franz von Stuck and Karl J. Becker – Gundhal, in Prague under Vlaho Bukovac, Jakub Obrovský and Vojtech Hynais, and in Dresden under Ferdinand Dorsch in Max Feldbauer. Before the WW II he was active as illustrator and painter. In his later life he became one of the most famous restorers and conservators of Yugoslavia.

The game shows the Kingdom of Yugoslavia in the late 1935 and traveling through the most important stops of the country, should increase the pan-Slavic feeling. All the stops on the board are described in the inner side of the box. The instructions end with a rhyme of a Slovene, Croat and Serb always being brothers.

The maps shows the most famous building of Yugoslavia. As most of them are older buildings, Ljubljana is shown with the modern Art Deco building “NebotiÄnik” (Skyscaper), the tallest building on the Balkans at the time, finished by 1933. NebotiÄnik was the first reinforced concrete building in Europa.

The architect of NebotiÄnik, Vladimir Šubic, was a brother of the illustrator of this game, Mirko Šubic.

The map can be dated after the opening of NebotiÄnik in 1933 and before 1939, when two regions (banovine) of 9 in the Kingdom of Yugoslavia, merged into one. The 8 regions existed until 1941, at the beginning of the WW II.

—user summary

Name: Senda Zen
Description:
Each player represents a sage who seeks to walk a path that leads him from corner to corner. The two players draw their paths through a mobile board, based on the strategy of movements, where planning and spatial vision are fundamental. Enjoy your path and find the best solutions to reach your goal in this peaceful duel.

Senda Zen is a 2-player puzzle, in which the objective is to walk, with your sage, the necessary path until you reach your opponent's starting point.

—description from the publisher

Name: Brincar + Juntos
Description:
A game to bring the whole family together. Create special moments in this game for parents and children.
A fun game that strengthens the bonds between parents and children, through simple activities that entertain adults and children, creating a special moment for the whole family.
It works like this: Shuffle the cards and place them in the center of the group. The first player takes a card and follows the instructions that come on it.
Then the next player takes the next card and also follows the instructions, and so on, until the END card is chosen or the cards are finished. Have a good time!
With a handcrafted look, the game was developed by the Chilean designer Carolina Baltra.

Name: Abstratus: Kit Expansão
Description:
Want to make your dispute more exciting?
The expansion kit allows two more players to enter the game, making it even more sensational!

Name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game (Second Edition) – Long May He Reign
Description:
Long May He Reign is the sixth Chapter Pack in the King's Landing cycle for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game.

The King’s Landing cycle takes a new approach to the Game of Thrones LCG. Rather than following the plot of A Song of Ice and Fire, this cycle is centered around the capital of the seven kingdoms, allowing you to explore the world of Westeros more freely than ever before. Every Chapter Pack in this cycle features three copies each of twenty unique cards to strengthen your decks and help you embrace the deadly intrigues of A Song of Ice and Fire with the continued cultivation of the shadow keyword, first reintroduced in the Dance of Shadows cycle.

Your journey to the capital of the seven kingdoms brings you to the throne room as you stand in the shadow of the Iron Throne itself. Focusing on themes of legacy and honor, this Chapter Pack includes a new agenda centered around attachments and new versions of favorite characters seeking to leave the past behind. The shadows have fallen on Westeros— do you have the determination to survive the long night and lead the realm to a new dawn?

—description from the publisher
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: A Game of Thrones – The Card Game (LCG)

Name: Deep Space Conveyance
Description:
In Deep Space Conveyance, players take on the role of shipping companies trying to deliver goods accross the galaxy, fulfilling contracts and objectives.

Expand your company's empire by establishing outposts on planets, unlocking special abilities and discovering powerful technologies.

Develop your weapons to hinder your opponents, defend your ship and destroy space pirates for greater rewards.

—description from the designer

Name: Crimson Woods
Description:
Welcome to Camp Crimson Woods! Where you will get plenty of cardio running for your life! Crimson Woods is a co-operative survival horror game where you are trying to find an escape route out of camp before you fall victim to the killer or are lost in the woods forever!

You and your fellow camp counselors will be searching the camp grounds for resources to escape and ultimately survive. The campsite is made up of a 36 tile modular board that will allow the killer to stalk you and inevitably pop up on your tile and attack you!

You don't have to be the first to escape, just ESCAPE and you WIN!

—description from the publisher

Name: NewSpeak: Rated
Description:
Navigate the precarious world of social ratings in this modular expansion for NewSpeak, bringing Dissident Player ratings and Location ratings to the game to add another element to the code-breaking challenge. Play as two all-new Dissident characters, and don’t forget - keep your rating high!

In Rated, each dissident player is assigned a social rating wheel as well as their targeting dial, showing their social rating to moderators at all times. Each location is also randomly assigned a social rating token.

If a dissident is caught by a moderator, their social rating is decreased by one to a minimum of one. Dissidents may not target a location that has a higher social rating than they currently have. The only way to get around this is to avoid capture, or focus on a diminishing number of locations that have been unfiltered by the dissidents - which have a rating of 1 by default.

—description from the publisher

Name: NewSpeak: Sabotage
Description:
Expand your Dissident team to incorporate up to 8 players in each game of Newspeak. While your Dissident team may be larger, there may be traitors amongst you - seeking to secretly communicate with the Moderators to undermine your revolutionary efforts.

Sabotage includes materials to extend your games of NewSpeak to 8 players from up to 6 in the core set, with an additional set of 'loyalty' cards for up to 6 dissident players, allowing for an extra layer of subterfuge, assigning up to 2 dissident players a secret identity as a moderator mole. While traitors can be outed by majority vote of the remaining dissident players, an incorrect accusation will cost them dearly.

—description from the publisher

Name: Once Upon a Time: Fairytale Mash-ups
Description:
All Together Now!

Everyone knows Cinderella, Humpty Dumpty, and the Three Bears. And everyone knows to avoid magic bean peddlers and ovens big enough for children. But what happens when all these classic fairytale elements — and more! — come together in the same story?

Mash-ups is an expansion for Once Upon a Time, the card game where players tell a story using cards that show fairytale elements and endings. Add these cards to your Once Upon a Time game to find out what happens when classic fairytales collide!

—description from the publisher

Name: Arkham Horror (Third Edition): Dead of Night
Description:
Kate Winthrop pulled the collar of her long coat tight against her neck to ward o the creeping chill of a damp autumn night. With a squeal of tires, a long black car raced by, pursued closely by a police wagon. Kate pressed herself up against the iron railing of the bridge over the Miskatonic to keep clear of the chaos.

She’d read in the papers about the recent upsurge in violent crime and felt the increasing tension all around the city. As the nights grew longer, she noticed a deeper darkness lurking in the shadows around Arkham, and the instruments in her research lab at the university were responding to some influence that she couldn’t observe.

Something was coming.

Step into a world of horror with Dead of Night, a new expansion for Arkham Horror Third Edition!

In Dead of Night, investigators explore the facets of Arkham best left unseen in the light of day. Organized crime builds a strong foothold in the city, secret cults labor for a dark master, an alien moon hangs overhead, and unknowable horrors stalk the night. This expansion includes two all-new scenarios, new encounters for every location in Arkham, new monsters and anomalies, and four new investigators to face these fresh horrors, armed with new spells, items and allies.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Boombox Game: Rewind to The 80's & 90's
Description:
Become the mix master of this 80's and 90's jam.

The players create compilations of songs for unique "life scenarios," like: a song to play at a campfire -- or a song to do an interpretive dance to.

A turn plays out as follows: One player places a card describing the scenario. Each of the other players contributes a face down song-title card from their hand which is their pick for the 'perfect' song for the current scenario. The player who chose the scenario then picks which song is best. The player who submitted that song wins a token.

The winner is the player with the most scoring tokens after four rounds of play.

Name: Animal Color
Description:
Animal Color is a collection of 16 Games that can be played with the same deck of 42 cards, containing 32 of them with 4 different animals and 4 different color backgrounds, 9 wild cards and 1 Animal/Color card.

The games are:

1. Line
Players must play at the same time cards in the Line on the center of the table trying to avoid matches with any other card´s Colors or Animals on it. When all cards are played, the Player with fewer cards is the Winner!!

2. Battlefronts
Players must play cards in any of the 3 battlefronts available to destroy the opposing battlefront. The first Player to destroy 3 opposing battlefronts Wins!!

3. Pushing
Push cards on the grid to make it enters in the other player´s zone. But remember, all players have a secret Protection. The one with fewer point Wins!!

4. Roads
Try to get out from all of your hand´s cards by playing them in the table forming Roads. Play all yours card to Win the game!!

5. Missions
Players take cards and use them to complete Missions. Better Missions, more cards. At the end of the game, the player with more cards Wins!!

6. Smack it All 
Players take one card per turn from the deck, until someone notices they are three cards matching with one of the Wild Cards in the center of the Table. The First one to Smack it win that three cards. When the deck is depleted the player with more cards is the Winner!!

7. Liars
Duel other players with your card. If they find out you lie, you lose and give that card. If they not, you win the duel and the card. The player with most sets done with the cards Wins!!

8. Groups Forge
Players take cards from the table and then together with the ones in their hands, they forge Groups to win points. When any Player forge his/her third group, end the round an count the Points provided by the groups. The one with most Points Win the Game!!

9. Stocks
Players take cards from the deck and then bet one of them on one of the Stock available on the table. When the deck is depleted, players sell their cards to the Stocks available and the One with more Points is the Winner!!

10. Between Zoos
Players play cards to their right or their left. These are shared with that respective side players, when deck depletes players choose 1 Animal and 1 Color to point from the cards in the right, the left and the one still in their Hands. The player with more points Wins!!

11. Confrontation
Players must choose to keep giving the cards to other player to get a full 3 card match, or ending the turn and giving the other player that chance. When the Deck runs out of cards, player with most cards is the Winner!!

12. Cooperative
Players must play three matching cards every round to draw another three cards from the deck. If Players runs out of cards, the game ends and all Players lose. But if the deck is depleted, all Players Wins!!

13. Match 4 in line
Players must guess where (behind a grid of 4x4 cards) hide a 4 in line of a matching Color or a matching Animal. They can look at one card or switch between two adjacent cards. The First one to guess correctly is the Winner!!

14. Memory-Bear
A classic game with a re-twist. Find the exact pair of a card to get the 2 caeds, or find any Wild card and get the card in that moment. When the cards in the table are over, the one with most cards WIN!

15. Tower
Players must take cards from the tower to match with their secret objectives and form sets of three cards to get the most Points and Win the Game!!

16. Expedition 
A solitaire expedition to the pyramid. The player must complete a chain of cards matching the Color or the Animal to Win!!

—description from the publisher

Name: British vs Pirates: Limited Edition Captains
Description: This is a promo package of 3 captina cards for use in Britih Vs Pirates. These is one each for the British, Spanish, and Pirate factions.

Name: British vs Pirates: Limited Edition Ships
Description: This is a promo package of 3 ship cards for use in British vs Pirates. These is one each for the British, Spanish, and Pirate factions.

Name: British vs Pirates: Forts Add-on
Description: Adds 3 fort miniatures with corresponding fort cards for use in British Vs Pirates.  Forts are for British, Pirate, and Spanish factions.

Name: Rideshare Wars
Description:
In Rideshare Wars, you are the operator of a rideshare corporation and you are competing for riders across six cities (represented by rider cards that you use to build your “market presence” tableau). There are two ways to win:

1. Collect Milestone Cards: A player wins immediately if they have earned the following number of milestone cards:

2 players - 6 milestone cards
3 players - 5 milestone cards
4 players - 4 milestone cards

You gain 1 milestone card if:

> You are the first player to have riders in all 3 zones of a city (Each city has three zones in it –Uptown zone, Midtown zone and Downtown zone)

> At end of your turn, you have at least one rider in: 

     Most Uptown zones (minimum 3 zones required) 
     Most Midtown zones (minimum 3 zones required) 
     Most Downtown zones (minimum 3 zones required) 
     Most Cities (minimum of 3 cities required)


2. Highest score: If no player wins by milestone cards, the game is played over 15 rounds (divided into 3 Phases of 5 rounds each)

     Your score is calculated from the value of riders in your tableau, but only for cities you control. You control a city if you most rider cards in that city compared to other players.
     Milestone cards you earned score 3 points each.
     Then subtract 4 points for each loan card


—description from the designer

Name: Can You Save This Dude?
Description:
In Can You Save This Dude, you are a medical scientist on a mission to save the life of a patient infected by a deadly virus. The patient could die if body temperature, pulse, or blood pressure (“BP”) to spike to lethal levels, or if the virus spreads throughout the whole body.

You have at your disposal 3 types of drugs for treating the patient:

     Blue drug (represented by blue dice) which directly fights the virus (represented by red dice). But as a side effect, it causes the patient’s body temperature to rise
     Green drug (represented by green dice) for managing temperature increase side effect caused by the blue drug.
     White drugs (represented by white dice), being basic drugs for stabilizing blood pressure and pulse. Can also be combined into a Mega Drug which can instantly cure patient


There are 2 ways to win the game:
a) Eliminate the virus from the body (by pushing red dice off the bottom of the virus track using blue dice), OR
b)Successfully create a Mega Drug with six white dice in it and instantly cure the patient.

The patient dies and you lose the game when either:

     Virus spreads and red dice reaches the “dead face” emoticon on the virus track OR
     Temperature, BP or pulse marker rises and reaches the “dead face” emoticon and you are unable to resuscitate the patient


—description from the designer

Name: Doomtown: Out For Blood
Description:
It's another long, hot summer as the Doomtown saga continues in Tombstone, Arizona.  Tempers boil over.  Seedy glares lead to brawls.  Fistfights lead to gunfights between the Outlaws and Law Dogs.  And both sides are out for blood.

This new Doomtown expansion features 4 copies of 56 new cards, including a new home for each of the 6 factions and a brand new legend, Doc Holliday!

With 56 new cards, Out For Blood gives you new ways to customize your Doomtown decks. Whether your style is shootin’, spell castin’, or just trying to show that you have more money and influence than the next person, Out For Blood expands your options in Tombstone!

—description from the publisher

Name: Na łące
Description:
Na Å‚Ä…ce is a small memo, bluffing game, where you collect animals living on meadow. Each turn every player collects two tiles and without showing them to other players he declares if they have the same animal on it or they are different. If they are different, he puts them on the table, leaving one visible to other players. If he says they are the same—other players can check if he is not bluffing. If he does he must give one of his tiles back to the box, if not he collects tiles and the one checking him returns one of his tiles to the box. 
At the end of the game you score points for ducks (3 points each) and animals (1 point for each).

—description from the publisher

Name: Junktech: Duel
Description:
The selfishness of humankind has turned the planet into a giant junkyard. Fight to Survive!

In Junktech: Duel players must use their reflexes, perceptiveness, strategic thinking as well as their character’s unique abilities to win. By combining all of these elements we have created an innovative mechanic that allows the card game to simulate real combat. Junktech: Duel is a game of simple rules, high replayability and frantic combinations in every turn. Manage your cards and resources wisely!

—description from the publisher

Name: エンジェリストゲーム (Angelist Game)
Description:
A quirky double-layered rock-paper-scissors card game with a "you don't get your cards" draft at the start.

Cards are in five types: Three Elements and Light and Dark. The Elements have a Rock-Paper-Scissors relationship. All Elements beat Light, Light beats Dark, and Dark beats all elements.

At the beginning of the game, 8 cards are dealt to each players, and then drafted half at a time (first choose 4 cards, then 2, then 1), but the players normally don't get the pile that they created.

After the draft, the game is played by one player specifying an opponent and revealing one hand card each, winning as per the above relationship. Winning with an Element deals 1 damage, but gives points. Winning with Darkness deals 2 damage, but gives no points. Winning with Light heals yourself for 1 damage and gives many points.

Rince and repeat until one player runs out of cards (most points wins) or just one lives (that player wins).

Special character extra power cards are added to the fray for spice.

—user summary

Name: Thunderstone Quest: Vengeful Sands
Description:
This is Quest #8 for Thunderstone Quest, first made available through the Thunderstone Quest: New Horizons Kickstarter campaign.

Each Quest consists of a selection of dungeon tiles and monster cards that create an engaging storyline. Each Quest includes rules for selecting Village and Dungeon cards to create a variety of Adventures. After you've mastered each Quest you use random setups of Quest cards to create new Dungeons and Villages - build your own Quests and Adventures!

Name: Thunderstone Quest: Clockwork Destiny
Description:
This is Quest #9 for Thunderstone Quest, first made available through the Thunderstone Quest: New Horizons Kickstarter campaign.

Each Quest consists of a selection of dungeon tiles and monster cards that create an engaging storyline. Each Quest includes rules for selecting Village and Dungeon cards to create a variety of Adventures. After you've mastered each Quest you use random setups of Quest cards to create new Dungeons and Villages - build your own Quests and Adventures!

Name: Quizzen und Buzzern: Allgemeinwissen
Description:
Who knows the right answer? Who's the first to push the buzzer? This Quiz-Game tests your general knowledge.

Here's how it works:
A player reads out the question. The other players try to give the correct answer. Who knows the answer, hits the buzzer and answers. The person who has answered most questions correctly, wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Quizzen und Buzzern: Popquiz
Description:
Who knows the right answer and is quick-witted? Who's the first to push the buzzer? This quiz-game tests your knowledge about pop music.

Here's how it works:
A player reads out the question. The other players try to give the correct answer. The person who knows the answer, hits the buzzer and answers. The one who has answered most questions correctly, wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Quizzen und Buzzern: Filmquiz
Description:
Who knows the right answer? Who's the first to push the buzzer? This quiz-game tests your knowledge about movies.

Here's how it works:
A player reads out the question. The other players try to give the correct answer. The person who knows the answer, hits the buzzer and answers. The one who has answered most questions correctly, wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Das große Literaturquiz von A-Z
Description:
With this entertaining quiz you can playfully test your knowledge about literatur. From the bestseller to the biography - there are over 300 questions waiting for you to be answered.  
Lots of entertaining knowledge for everyone who likes to read!

—description from the publisher

Name: The Kazakh Khanate
Description: The Kazakh Khanate (Qazaq Khanate) is a competitive game for 2-4 players where each player tries to unite a certain number of the Kazakh clans under one banner the fastest.  Players take turns moving around the board claiming clans or battling for their support.

Name: Stockpile: Epic Edition
Description:
The Epic Edition includes all content ever made for Stockpile. This includes the base game, Continuing Corruption expansion, all previous promo cards, the new Stockpile: Illicit Investments expansion and all Daily Dividends in one exclusive box.

The Epic Edition is exclusive to Kickstarter, with a limited extra quantity printed for conventions and the publisher's webstore.

Name: Sophisticuffs
Description: A collectible 2-person card game with simple 2-second battle rules: each player secretly chooses a combatant card from their collection. The combatant cards are then held head-to-head, so that lines of colored numbers at the top of each card align. In the column where the colors are the same (there will always be exactly one), the combatant with the higher number wins.

Name: Jingo The Outer Space Jigsaw Bingo Game
Description:
Another Jigsaw Bingo Game of the same publisher of Jingo.

Each player receives a cardboard "board" with a 5x5 grid that has variously shaped pieces punched out of it. The pieces are dumped into the middle of the table and all plays simultaneously try to be the first to fit five pieces in a row to win the round.

Winner of the round scores 10 points plus 2 points for each additional piece in their board beyond 5. All other players receive 1 point for each piece in their board. Game play continues unitl one player scores 50 points (or 100 for a longer game).

Name: BRL 1192: Operation Torch and Beyond
Description:
Are you ready to be one of the Rats of Tobruk? A DESERT FOX? We will provide you with the equipment. You bring your heart for this corner of history.

BRL 1192 Operation Torch and Beyond is the 7th expansion to BRL 1192: Tobruk Deprogrammed and includes new layouts, art and proper counters for the overhead infantry.

Game description of BRL 1192 from the publisher:

In the early 1970's an innovator and ordnance expert named Harold "Hal" Hock got his hands on a document unseen outside of military circles: BRL 1192 (Ballistics Research Lab, Document No. 1192). The data within became the core of the ground-breaking design, Tobruk: Tank Battles in North Africa 1942.

Years later, an MIT-grad and devotee saw the potential of reverse-engineering the 'programmed instruction' rules; the result is something that brings back the approach to tank vs. tank warfare, and keeps the approach true, creating a truly unique system of recreating the war in North Africa and beyond.

BRL 1192: Tobruk Deprogrammed is an enhanced edition of the original Tobruk; the heart of the game remains the same, but now it can be enjoyed with a deprogrammed 24-page rulebook, revised play aids, a comprehensive selection of counters representing the men, weapons and machinery of WWII North Africa, plus a collection of geomorphic maps and new terrain overlays.

Name: Retro Hero
Description:
Retro Hero is the first of many games for the Retro Gamer Device. Players start by randomly selecting 5 level cards (this is your cartridge) and inserting them into their Retro Gamer Device. Each level has a predetermined number of turns so players must try and make the best with the options they're presented.

The goal is to collect points while navigating across levels, moving with the help of shapes chosen from the options rolled on your adventure dice. Points are mainly collected by covering as many empty spaces as possible (venture points); defeating creatures scattered across the levels; and using a key to open the lock. There are also several other ways of accumulating points such as Treasure Cards and Side Quests.

Items found in a level are collected when covered, adding to your player board or wallet. When covering creatures, players attack by drawing cubes from a bag. Successful attacks earn you points while taking hits will cost you health. Players can press their luck to earn maximum points but risk dying in the process.  If a player does run out of health during an attack, they lose a point as consequence but are revived on their next turn, continuing from where they left off.

The Treasure Cards that are collected are added to the limited slots on your player board to help you along the way. Their content ranges between Spells, Companions, and Special Items.

Bombs are a vital part of the game as they enable players to take shortcuts and sometimes access items that are otherwise unavailble. If a player wishes to cover a brick with their chosen shape, they will need to spend a bomb. Bombs (like all items) are either collected or purchased.

Retro Hero is a truly unique dungeon crawling experience with up to 40 levels to choose from and 11 different shapes to dictate your every move. The player with the most points becomes the Ultimate Retro Hero!

—description from the publisher

Name: The Potion: Magic Scroll
Description:
The best alchemists around the globe have reunited to brew the perfect potion!

Add the Magic Scroll' expansion to your copy of The Potion to play the new co-operative mode. Try to match the recipes on the dice in order to get rid of your ingredients. If you fail doing so, you will ruin the potion and have to start again!

Players cannot speak. They must use their deduction skills to choose the right ingredients to match what the potion requires to be brewed. Each time a player fails matching the recipe, they put their ingredient beside the bottle. Each time they succeed, they place it inside the bottle.

Win the game by having one alchemist within the group left with only one type of ingredient in hand. However, the more ingredients you put in the bottle, the better the potion you will create...

Name: Temple Crush
Description:
Two play modes, Co-op for 1+ players or Versus for 2+ players.  Players venture into a collapsing temple to rob it of riches while trying to avoid being crushed by falling masonry blocks.  Players move through the temple before pulling blocks from a bag that must be placed around the temple, moving other blocks aside to make way trying to gain a set amount of coins in Co-op or competing for the most in Versus mode.

—description from the designer

Name: Match Madness: Extreme
Description:
Enjoy the Match Madness Extreme frenzy! Recreate 60 new pattern cards by adding a 3D cube to your set of blocks. The ingenious the pattern matching race is on!

Each player receives a set of 5 blocks (numbered from 1 to 5) from the base game and 1 cube block (numbered 6) from the expansion. Leave the Match Madness base game cards aside and take the cards from the expansion box (level 6 cards).

Try to Match the cards using the new cube that comes with the expansion and experience all the fun of Match Madness again with 60 new puzzles!

—description from the publisher
